column2: Now for our next Power-up. Hope you like fireworks!
Of course!
Excellent. Launch Lightspeed.

We're going to add code so a Power-up of type `'blowup'` blows up every enemy on the screen.

This is very similar to the other one. Click the Flip button.

See the `activatePowerup()` function in the Power-ups tab? The `'invulnerable'` Power-up makes us invulnerable. 

Now we want to add a setting for Power-up `'blowup'`. So if we pick up one of these, we blow up everything.

See how there's an `if (powerUpType == 'invulnerable')` check already? You will add a similar one for Power-up `'blowup'`.

Then instead of setting `ship.invulnerableTimer = 5;` you will use `blowUpEnemies();`.
Just before the final `}` on the last line, type in `if (powerUpType == 'blowup')`
And then `blowUpEnemies();`. And that should do it. Test it out.
Play the level to test it.
Click that handy *Restart* button.
Let's give it another go, shall we?
Press *Restart.*
Let's see what happens when you pick up both kinds of Power-ups.
All Power-ups seem to be doing the same thing.
Go back and make sure we have the two `if` statements.
Major fireworks! Go ahead and finish the level now with the help of the Power-ups!
Hmm, these Power-ups don't seem to have any powers! Go back and see what you can do.
Excellent. Okay, only one more Power-up before we can get our next fob to open the box.
One picked, can you pick the other kind?.
Did you mean to pick the other type? You can go pick that one now.
You couldn't pick any Power-up? Are you aure they are being spawned? Maybe check on that.
No problem, we can try it again later.
